snippet: Thousands of people argue that Terrance Williams, scheduled to be executed by lethal injection on Oct. 3, should be spared in Pennsylvania because he had been sexually abused by his victim.
abstract: Thousands of people argue that convicted murderer Terrance Williams, scheduled to be executed in Pennsylvania by lethal injection on Oct. 3, should be granted clemency because he had been sexually abused by his victim, Amos Norwood; petition urging Gov Tom Corbett and state's Board of Pardons to commute his sentence to life without parole has been signed by about 286,000 supporters.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of people argue that Terrance Williams, scheduled to be executed by lethal injection on Oct. 3, should be spared in Pennsylvania because he had been sexually abused by his victim.

headline.seo: A Push for Clemency in Pennsylvania as an Execution Nears
headline.main: A Push for Clemency as an Execution Nears
headline.print_headline: A Push for Clemency As an Execution Nears
